titles.title: Civil War Battlefields Preservation Tax Incentives Act of 1994
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to encourage the preservation of Civil War battlefields for public purposes.

action.text: Sponsor introductory remarks on measure. (CR E1552)
Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 7/25/1994--Introduced. Civil War Battlefields Preservation Tax Incentives Act of 1994 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow a deduction from the value of a gross estate of the transfer by an heir of a qualified conservation easement on land within a Civil War battlefield site. Provides that the dollar limitation on the valuation of farm and other real property does not apply to property within a Civil War battlefield site. Allows a tax credit of 50 percent of the amount of any qualified Civil War battlefield charitable contribution.
